column3: Manpages are generated from the help outputs. So consider to change the `bitcoind -help` output rather the `bitcoind manpage` please.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #14100 (doc: Change documentation for =0 for non-boolean options by laanwj)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
ACK. Could you do the same for `checkblockindex` and `checkmempool`, please?
Updated and rebased, `checkmempool` regtest is 1 right ?

tACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14013/commits/e8c4a1e36969d2ef816d9dfaaee979a8cf6bfffe

master (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/68f3c7eb080e461cfeac37f8db7034fe507241d0):
```
src/bitcoin-cli -?
-rpcport=<port>
       Connect to JSON-RPC on <port> (default: 8332 or testnet: 18332)

src/bitcoind -? -help-debug
-port=<port>
       Listen for connections on <

I think the reason that regtest was never mentioned in docs like this is that it is considered a developer/debug feature, not a user-facing one.\nThough, now that option help is no longer translated I don't think it's necessary to be so strict about that anymore here.\nutACK e8c4a1e36969d2ef816d9dfaaee979a8cf6bfffe
Would prefer to use (reg)testnetChainParams here instead of hardcoding
